1.name: chembl
1.description: A database of bioactive drug-like small molecules and bioactivities abstracted from the scientific literature.
1.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided on ftp site for each release.

2.name: drugbank
2.description: A database that combines drug (i.e. chemical, pharmacological and pharmaceutical) data with drug target (i.e. sequence, structure, and pathway) information.
2.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided within sd file on ftp site for each release.

3.name: pdb
3.description: The European resource for the collection, organisation and dissemination of data on biological macromolecular structures, including structures of small molecule ligands for proteins.
3.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided by direct querying of Oracle DB.

4.name: gtopdb
4.description: The IUPHAR (International Union of Basic and Clinical Pharmacology)/BPS (British Pharmacological Society) Guide to PHARMACOLOGY database contains structures of small molecule ligands, peptides and antibodies, with their affinities at protein targets.
4.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys available for download at http://www.guidetopharmacology.org/download.jsp

5.name: pubchem_dotf
5.description: A subset of the PubChem DB: from the original depositor 'drugs of the future' (Prous).
5.srcDetails: Mol files for SIDs downloaded manually, via PubChem interface, and Standard InChIs and Keys generated by InChI software. SIDs used as identifiers.
5.updateComments: Considered a static deposition into pubchem

6.name: kegg_ligand
6.nameLong: KEGG (Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes) Ligand
6.description: KEGG LIGAND is a composite DB consisting of COMPOUND, GLYCAN, REACTION, RPAIR, RCLASS, and ENZYME DBs, whose entries are identified by C, G, R, RP, RC, and EC numbers, respectively.
6.srcDetails: Mol files were downloaded manually prior to this download becoming private. Standard InChIs and Keys generated by InChI software.

7.name: chebi
7.description: ChEBI is a freely available dictionary of molecular entities focused on 'small' chemical compounds
7.srcDetails: Std InChis (but no keys) provided on ftp site. Keys generated by UniChem. 'all star' compounds downloaded

8.name: nih_ncc
8.description: Collections of plated arrays of small molecules that have a history of use in human clinical trials. Assembled by the National Institutes of Health (NIH) through the Molecular Libraries Roadmap Initiative
8.srcDetails: Mol files downloaded manually and Standard InChIs and Keys generated by InChI software

9.name: zinc
9.description: A free database of commercially-available compounds for virtual screening, provided by the Shoichet Laboratory in the Department of Pharmaceutical Chemistry at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF).  [Irwin and Shoichet, J. Chem. Inf. Model. 2005;45(1):177-82]
9.srcDetails: novirtual subset of ZINC15, as a file containing inchis and keys from http://files.docking.org/export/unichem/

10.name: emolecules
10.description: A free chemical structure search engine containing millions of public domain structures. Pricing, availabilities, and vendor information requires an eMolecules Plus subscription.
10.srcDetails: Downloaded as an SD file from source, Converted to InChI and INChIKeys by UniChem

12.name: atlas
12.description: The Gene Expression Atlas is a semantically enriched database of meta-analysis based summary statistics over a curated subset of ArrayExpress Archive, servicing queries for condition-specific gene expression patterns as well as broader exploratory searches for biologically interesting genes/samples.

14.name: fdasrs
14.description: The primary goal of the FDA/USP Substance Registration System (SRS) is to unambiguously define all substances present in regulated products. Once a substance has been defined, the SRS assigns a strong identifier that is permanently associated with the substance: a UNII (Unique Ingredient Identifier). This is a a non-proprietary, free, unique, unambiguous, nonsemantic, alphanumeric identifier based on a substances molecular structure and/or descriptive information.
14.srcDetails: Download of InChIKeys in file UNII Data  from http://fdasis.nlm.nih.gov/srs/jsp/srs/uniiListDownload.jsp

15.name: surechembl
15.description: SureChEMBL automatically extracts chemistry from the full text of all major patent authorities. Compounds are derived from either chemical names found in text or in chemical depictions. All SureChEMBL compounds are included, except those failing UniChem loading rules.
15.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and InChIKeys provided by a direct feed from the SureChEMBL database

17.name: pharmgkb
17.description: PharmGKB (Pharmacogenomics Knowledgebase) is a comprehensive resource that curates knowledge about the impact of genetic variation on drug response for clinicians and researchers.
17.srcDetails: drugs.zip file from from download site https://www.pharmgkb.org/downloads/. Smiles contained in this file Converted to Std InChIs internally

18.name: hmdb
18.description: The Human Metabolome Database (HMDB) is a freely available electronic database containing detailed information about small molecule metabolites found in the human body. It is intended to be used for applications in metabolomics, clinical chemistry, biomarker discovery and general education. The database is designed to contain or link three kinds of data: 1) chemical data, 2) clinical data, and 3) molecular biology/biochemistry data
18.srcDetails: SD file download from source, converted to InChIs within UniChem

20.name: selleck
20.description: Selleck Chemicals is a supplier of biochemical products, including over 1,000 inhibitor products
20.srcDetails: SD file provided by email. InChIs generated by UniChem
20.updateComments: Need to evaluate - currently default static set

21.name: pubchem_tpharma
21.description: A subset of the PubChem DB: from the original depositor 'Thomson Pharma'.
21.srcDetails: Mol files for SIDs downloaded manually, via PubChem interface, and Standard InChIs and Keys generated by InChI software. SIDs used as identifiers.
21.updateComments: Considered a static deposition into pubchem

22.name: pubchem
22.description: A database of normalized PubChem compounds (CIDs) from the PubChem Database.
22.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided on ftp site.

23.name: mcule
23.description: An online drug discovery platform with virtual screening and molecular modelling services.
23.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided by email.

24.name: nmrshiftdb2
24.description: An NMR database (web database) for organic structures and their nuclear magnetic resonance (nmr) spectra. It allows for spectrum prediction (13C, 1H and other nuclei) as well as for searching spectra, structures and other properties. Last not least, it features peer-reviewed submission of datasets by its users.
24.srcDetails: Standard InChI and Keys available for download at http://nmrshiftdb.nmr.uni-koeln.de/nmrshiftdb2unichem.txt

25.name: lincs
25.nameLong: Library of Integrated Network-based Cellular Signatures
25.description: The LINCS DCIC facilitates and standardized the information relevant to LINCS assays as described in http://www.lincsproject.org/data/data-standards/

26.name: actor
26.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys generated from SMILES from DB download

27.name: recon
27.description: A biochemical knowledge-base on human metabolism
27.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided by email

28.name: molport
28.description: MolPort. A database designed to assist users find commercial sources of compounds. Access requires (free) registration. Only stock compounds included from Nov 2017.
28.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided on from MolPort ftp site, access on request.

29.name: nikkaji
29.description: Nakkaji (The Japan Chemical Substance Dictionary) is an organic compound dictionary database prepared by the Japan Science and Technology Agency (JST).
29.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys available from ftp site

31.name: bindingdb
31.description: A public, web-accessible database of measured binding affinities, focusing chiefly on the interactions of proteins considered to be drug-targets with small, drug-like molecules
31.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys available within a tsv file from download page.

32.name: comptox
32.description: The foundation of chemical safety testing relies on chemistry information such as high-quality chemical structures and physicochemical properties. This information is used by scientists to predict the potential health risks of chemicals.The CompTox Dashboard is part of a suite of dashboards developed by EPA to help evaluate the safety of chemicals. It provides access to a variety of data and information on over 700,000 chemicals currently in use and of interest to environmental researchers. Within the CompTox Dashboard, users can access chemical structures, experimental and predicted physicochemical and toxicity data, and additional links to relevant websites and applications. It maps curated physicochemical property data associated with chemical substances to their corresponding chemical structures
32.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys obtained from download page

33.name: lipidmaps
33.description: LIPID Metabolites And Pathways Strategy (LIPID MAPS) is a multi-institutional effort created to identify and quantitate, using a systems biology approach and sophisticated mass spectrometers, all of the major, and many minor, lipid species in mammalian cells, as well as to quantitate the changes in these species in response to perturbation
33.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys obtained from download page

34.name: drugcentral
34.description: DrugCentral is an online drug information resource created and maintained by Division of Translational Informatics at University of New Mexico, providing information on active ingredients chemical entities, pharmaceutical products, drug mode of action, indications, pharmacologic action
34.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys available as a download.

35.name: carotenoiddb
35.description: A Database of information on naturally occurring carotenoids from many organisms, extracted  from the literature.
35.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys available as a download

36.name: metabolights
36.description: A database for Metabolomics experiments and derived information. The database is cross-species, cross-technique and covers metabolite structures and their reference spectra as well as their biological roles, locations and concentrations, and experimental data from metabolic experiments.
36.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys available from FTP site

37.name: brenda
37.description: A comprehensive Enzyme Information system containing enzyme functional data extracted directly from the primary literature.
37.srcDetails: Standard InChIKeys available as a download

38.name: rhea
38.description: An expert curated resource of biochemical reactions designed for the annotation of enzymes and genome-scale metabolic networks and models
38.srcDetails: src_compound_ids  extracted from ChEBI download file.

39.name: chemicalbook
39.description: An online knowledge-base of chemicals and a platform of the Chinese domestic vendors in chemical industry
39.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided by email.

41.name: swisslipids
41.description: SwissLipids is an expert curated resource that provides a framework for the integration of lipid and lipidomic data with biological knowledge and models

45.name: dailymed
45.description: A database of marketed drugs in the USA, containing label and package insert information
45.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys generated from preferred term lookup in ChEMBL

46.name: clinicaltrials
46.description: Intervention names from ClinicalTrials.gov. A database of privately and publicly funded clinical studies conducted around the world

47.name: rxnorm
47.description: RxNorm provides normalized names for clinical drugs and links its names to many of the drug vocabularies commonly used in pharmacy management and drug interaction software

48.name: MedChemExpress
48.description: MedChemExpress is a chemical supplier that provides 15,000+ selective Inhibitors and Agonists.
48.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided by email
48.updateComments: Will be moved to a download once they work out how
